intro: Spermacoce gentianoides, commonly known as blue morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers, which are typically five-petaled and resemble those of the gentian. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Spermacoce gentianoides is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and along stream banks.
